titleStmt.title: Augustus J. Browne to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1869

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
New York May 26th 1864
To his Excellency
Govr Thomas E. Bramlette
Honored Sir:
The undersigned most respectfully & humbly petitions and solicits at your hands. the appointment of "Commissioner of Deeds." of your State in and for the State of New York.

He has held similar positions in and from most of the states of the Union (Yours Excepted) for the past Eight years. and trusts that of the few Democratic States. now, that he be able to embrace them all on his list

Tis not very long since he has returned from a Foreign Service in the United States Employ and having fully settled in the City has opp opened a
Law Office, uptown far from the general location of said kind of business. and altho but a short time, opened has had one application of "Commissioner of Deeds -- " of your State.
I beg that you will grant an assent to the above request. and will forward (as below) a favorable reply. -- awaiting which I close my hastily written scrawl. remainedremaining much obliged, &c

Yours Respectfully & Sincerely
Augustus J. Browne
President of 6th District
Geo. B. McClellan Club

Please address reply to --
A J Browne
166 -- Sixth avenue
new York N.Y

Comr Deeds
New York
A J. Browne
apptd
14th Sept/64
